summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorneys Teri Gibbs and Colleen Mullen, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney, coordinating interviews for two clients who are victims in the Jeffrey Epstein case (19 Cr. 490). The emails discuss scheduling in-person and video conference interviews, travel arrangements, and note a scheduled court hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney coordinating interview schedules and logistics for two clients who are victims in the Epstein case. She communicates with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.role: Attorney (likely with the U.S. Attorney's Office)
persons.context: Corresponds with Teri Gibbs regarding scheduling interviews, providing dial-in information, and addressing questions about the victim interview process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in case 19 Cr. 490. The emails discuss victim reports against him and the dismissal of the indictment following his death.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Listed as cc'd on an email from Teri Gibbs, indicating she is part of the legal team representing the victims.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Identified as the New York attorney who will accompany one of the victims (Ms. [redacted]) to her in-person interview with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death and indicated victims could be heard.

connections.description: Attorneys communicating to coordinate victim interviews and logistics for the Epstein case investigation.
Both are cc'd on emails regarding victim representation, suggesting they are part of the same legal team.
Teri Gibbs states that Arick Fudali, a New York attorney, will accompany a client to an interview.
Gibbs represents clients who are alleged victims of Epstein, placing her in an adversarial legal relationship with him.

events.title: Hearing on Dismissal of Indictment
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. The order indicated victims could be heard.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: Planned in-person interview at the U.S. Attorney's office with a victim (Ms. [redacted]), accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Video Conference
events.description: Planned video conference interview (via Skype) with a victim (Ms. [redacted]) who is located in Japan.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Courtroom 17B, 500 Pearl Street courthouse, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively scheduling interviews with alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019, shortly after his death.
A hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address the dismissal of the indictment against Epstein, with provisions for victims to address the court.
Victim services, including counseling and travel assistance for court, were being offered by the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office to the victims.
The legal team for the victims was attempting to determine if their clients appeared in photographs seized from Epstein's home.
The document shows coordination between private victim attorneys and federal prosecutors in the immediate aftermath of Epstein's death.
